action.action-desc: Mr. Moolenaar (for himself, Mr. Connolly, Mr. McCormick, Mr. Griffith, Mr. Lynch, and Mr. Moulton) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To reauthorize the Adams Memorial Commission, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the The Adams Memorial-Great American Heroes Act.

section.header: Extension of authority; Location of memorial

subsection.text: Section 2406 of the John D. Dingell, Jr. Conservation, Management, and Recreation Act (Public Law 116–9) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (l), by striking 2025 and inserting 2032; and
by adding at the end the following:

subsection.text: Notwithstanding other provision of law, there are authorized to be appropriated $50,000,000 to carry out the purposes of this section, subject to the following limitations:

paragraph.text: Any Federal funds made available under this section shall be matched on a 1-to-1 basis by non-Federal contributions.
Not more than 4 percent of Federal funds made available under this section may be used for administrative expenses.

subsection.header: Compliance with Standards for Commemorative Works
subsection.text: Section 1(c) of Public Law 107–62 (115 Stat. 411; 124 Stat. 1192; 127 Stat. 3880; 133 Stat. 750) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking The establishment and inserting Notwithstanding section 8908(c) of title 40, United States Code, the establishment; and

subsection.text: Section 2 of Public Law 107–315 (116 Stat. 2763) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking The commemorative and inserting (a) Except as provided in subsection (b), the commemorative; and
by adding at the end the following:

subsection.text: The commemorative work may be located within the area generally depicted as Adams Memorial: Eligible Additional Area on the map titled Adams Memorial: Eligible Additional Area prepared by the Adams Memorial Commission and dated February 25, 2025.
